perturbation.original_text:
"Advertising Revenue Share" has the meaning assigned to it in Section 7.1.
     "Advertising Services" means the advertising and promotional services (including the Digital Content Service, the Digital Carousel, the  Traditional Content Program, Lobby Promotions and Event Sponsorships) as described in Part A of Exhibit A.
perturbation.changed_text:
"Advertising Revenue Share" has the meaning assigned to it in Section 7.1.
     "Advertising Services" means promotional activities.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of specific examples of what constitutes 'Advertising Services' creates ambiguity. Later sections referring to specific advertising services (Digital Content Service, Digital Carousel etc.) are now unclear as their relationship to the broader definition is now undefined. This introduces uncertainty in how 'Advertising Revenue Share' is calculated if the scope of 'Advertising Services' is unclear.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 3.6 Policy Trailer; Branded Slots.

(a) Policy Trailer. The policy trailer will be (i) up to 60 seconds, (ii) exhibited in the Theatres after Showtime, (iii) be customized to include the name of the Network Affiliates Theatre business and (iii) used to feature content relating to Theatre policy and operations, and may include (w) a policy service announcement that promotes appropriate theatre behavior, (x) promotions of Network Affiliate Concessions, (y) upon prior written approval of Network Affiliate, other promotional materials of third-party products for which NCM sells advertising and is paid a fee (the "Policy Trailer"). All costs associated with producing the Policy Trailer shall be borne by Network Affiliate.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 3.6 Policy Trailer; Branded Slots.

(a) Policy Trailer. The policy trailer will be used to feature content relating to Theatre policy and operations. All costs associated with producing the Policy Trailer shall be borne by Network Affiliate.
perturbation.explanation: By removing specific details about the 'Policy Trailer' length, exhibition time, and customization options, the modified text contradicts the original intent. If later clauses reference these specific characteristics, they become unenforceable or ambiguous. For example, if revenue sharing depends on 'Policy Trailer' advertising revenue, its length becomes crucial but undefined, leading to a conflict.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 7.1 Access Fee

(a) Digital Screen Usage Fee. On or before sixty (60) days after the end of each month during the Term, NCM shall pay to Network Affiliate $30.00 per digitized screen (i.e., a screen connected to the Digital Content Network), provided Network Affiliate provides the required attendance and screen count information as such information time frames are established by NCM on a monthly basis.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 7.1 Access Fee

(a) Digital Screen Usage Fee. On or before sixty (60) days after the end of each month during the Term, NCM shall pay to Network Affiliate a screen usage fee, provided Network Affiliate provides the required attendance and screen count information.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the specific amount of '$30.00 per digitized screen' makes the 'Digital Screen Usage Fee' undefined. Subsequent sections that rely on this amount for calculating minimum fees or revenue sharing will create an internal contradiction because the key monetary value is missing, making enforcement of financial obligations uncertain.
